newsitem.title: UK: NWE GASOLINE DROPS UP TO $8, BETTER SUPPLIES SEEN.
newsitem.headline: NWE GASOLINE DROPS UP TO $8, BETTER SUPPLIES SEEN.

text.p: NWE gasoline lost up to $8 a tonne on barges on Monday as losses seen late last week were extended. Drops in cargo levels were less severe at around $4-5.
Talk of an end of a squeeze and expectations of more material becoming available towards the end of this week has pulled the rug from under gasoline.
Traders said activity was slow on Monday morning with the market in a quiet mood after recent price buffetting. More business was anticipated once the U.S. kicks in.
Unleaded premium barges were pegged around $212 fob, but nothing was heard concluded.
August swaps were down at $206.50 from $210.50 with September dropping $3 to $190.50.
